feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 24 at 11:53AM AKST until November 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze up to two tenths of an inch of ice. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 24 at 11:53AM AKST until November 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 12:25AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Wet Snow and mixed Rainfall Through Tonight... Wet snow mixed with rainfall in the Alaska Range south of Carlo Creek and Trims Camp will continue through tonight (Fri night). Travelers should be cautious of difficult and potentially slick roadways along the highway corridors due to this along with warmer temps above freezing.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Southern Denali Borough

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 12:20AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wintry Mix Possible Over Southwest Alaska Through Tonight... There is a slight chance of freezing rain from McGrath and Unalakleet southwest tonight through Friday night. The area southwest of Anvik, including the Yukon Delta, has a chance of freezing rain tonight through Friday night. If freezing rain does occur amounts will be light with only a thin glaze of ice.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Yukon River; Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys; North Slopes of the Western Alaska Range; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta Coast

Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 23 at 7:14PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKST FRIDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKST FRIDAY. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert. Fairbanks has a Stage 1 alert. &&
